law.catch_line: In a case under this subtitle, a court shall appoint an attorney to represent a parent who:...

section.section:
In a case under this subtitle, a court shall appoint an attorney to represent a parent who:
has a disability that makes the parent incapable of effectively participating in the case; or
when the parent must decide whether to consent under this subtitle, is still a minor.
To determine whether a disability makes a parent incapable of effectively participating in a case, a court, on its own motion or on motion of a party, may order examination of the parent.

In an adoption proceeding under this subtitle, a court shall appoint an attorney to represent a prospective adoptee who:
is at least 10 years old; and
is a minor; or
has a disability that makes the prospective adoptee incapable of effectively participating in the proceeding.
To determine whether a disability makes a child incapable of effectively participating in a case, a court, on its own motion or on motion of a party, may order examination of the child.

text.section:
An attorney or firm:
may represent more than one party in a case under this subtitle only if the Maryland Rules of Professional Conduct allow; and
may not represent a prospective adoptive parent and parent in the same case.
Counsel appointed under this section may be compensated for reasonable fees, as approved by the court.
